intro: Rorippa calycina, commonly known as the watercress, is a flowering plant in the Brassicaceae family. It is an aquatic or semi-aquatic species that typically grows in wetlands, stream edges, and other moist environments. The plant has small, alternate leaves that are often submerged or floating, with tiny white flowers that bloom in clusters. It is characterized by its rapid growth and ability to spread through both seeds and vegetative reproduction. Rorippa calycina is often used in culinary applications due to its peppery taste and nutritional value.
